parameters.name: BackupGatewayId
parameters.description:
The ID of the backup gateway.

> This parameter is required when **DestinationEndpointInstanceType** is set to agent.

parameters.name: BackupPlanId
parameters.description: The ID of the backup plan.

parameters.name: BackupSetId
parameters.description: The ID of the full backup set used for the restore. This parameter is mutually exclusive with RestoreTime.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: A client token to ensure the idempotence of the request. This prevents duplicate submissions.

parameters.name: CrossAliyunId
parameters.description: The UID of the Alibaba Cloud account for cross-account backup.

parameters.name: CrossRoleName
parameters.description: The name of the RAM role for cross-account backup.

parameters.name: DestinationEndpointDatabaseName
parameters.description:
The database name.

> This parameter is required if the database is a PostgreSQL or MongoDB database.

parameters.name: DestinationEndpointIP
parameters.description:
The database endpoint.

> This parameter is required when **DestinationEndpointInstanceType** is set to express, agent, or other.

parameters.name: DestinationEndpointInstanceID
parameters.description:
The ID of the database instance.

> This parameter is required when **DestinationEndpointInstanceType** is set to RDS, ECS, DDS, or Express.

parameters.name: DestinationEndpointInstanceType
parameters.description:
The location of the database. Valid values:

- **RDS**

- **ECS**

- **Express**: a database connected over a leased line, VPN Gateway, or Smart Access Gateway.

- **Agent**: a database connected using a backup gateway.

- **DDS**: an ApsaraDB for MongoDB instance.

- **Other**: a database connected over the Internet.

- **dg**: a self-managed database without a public IP address or port that is connected through Database Gateway (DG).

parameters.name: DestinationEndpointOracleSID
parameters.description:
The Oracle system ID (SID).

> This parameter is required if the database is an Oracle database.

parameters.name: DestinationEndpointPassword
parameters.description:
The password.

> This parameter is optional for Redis databases, and for MSSQL databases when DestinationEndpointInstanceType is set to agent. For all other scenarios, this parameter is required.

parameters.name: DestinationEndpointPort
parameters.description:
The database port.

> This parameter is required when **DestinationEndpointInstanceType** is set to express, agent, other, or ECS.

parameters.name: DestinationEndpointRegion
parameters.description:
The region of the database instance.

> This parameter is required when **DestinationEndpointInstanceType** is set to RDS, ECS, DDS, Express, or Agent.

parameters.name: DestinationEndpointUserName
parameters.description:
The database account.

> This parameter is optional for Redis databases, and for MSSQL databases when DestinationEndpointInstanceType is set to agent. For all other scenarios, this parameter is required.

parameters.name: DuplicateConflict
parameters.description:
The policy for handling conflicts with objects that have the same name. Currently, only the following value is supported:

**renamenew**: Renames the object if a conflict occurs.

parameters.name: RestoreDir
parameters.description: This parameter is required when **DestinationEndpointInstanceType** is set to agent and the backup schedule is for a MySQL database.

parameters.name: RestoreHome
parameters.description: The database program folder.

parameters.name: RestoreObjects
parameters.description:
The objects to restore.

- For more information, see the definition of the RestoreObjects parameter below. This parameter is optional when **DestinationEndpointInstanceType** is set to agent. For all other scenarios, this parameter is required.

- Template: `[{ "DBName": "source_database_name", "NewDBName": "destination_database_name" }]`

> This API operation only supports database-level restore. To restore specific tables, use the console. For more information, see [Restore a database](~~85543~~).

parameters.name: RestoreTaskName
parameters.description: The name of the restore job.

parameters.name: RestoreTime
parameters.description: The restore time. Example: 1554560477000.
